content: Yes, that's a good way to think about it. Modern dance, unlike ballet or other structured dance forms, focuses on the emotions, beliefs, and personal experiences of the dancer. It's less about following a predetermined set of steps and more about expressing oneself through a variety of movements, including those that are improvised in the moment. In this sense, modern dance is sometimes considered to be a form of self-exploration or therapy, as it allows individuals to connect with their emotions and express themselves in a unique and personalized way.
